name: Chatbot Mona
description: Chatbot Mona is a supporting tool for questions wrking on passport reminder services, mobile signatures and passport applications.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Forwarding of helpdeskcalls
description: Natural Language Processing (understanding spoken language) is used to automatically classify incoming telephone questions at the 1700 (Flemish Infoline), to integrally transcribe and document the conversations, and to suggest answers.
type: Audio processing

name: Chatbot VDAB
description: VDAB is testing some innovative technologies that can help job seekers to find a matching vacancy. https://www.agoria.be/nl/VDAB-gebruikt-AI-om-jobmatching-te-verrijken    Among other things, the VDAB experiments with chatbots to better match jobseekers with the right vacancies. A chatbot is an automated conversation partner that participates in typed conversations. VDAB is also investigating how chatbots can guide job seekers in their search by automatically answering questions and addressing job seekers.  http://chatbotvanvdab.be/
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Citizen Lab NLP AI
description: Digital participation platforms are important tools for increasing citizen engagement and improving government responsiveness. However, analysing the high volumes of citizen input collected on these platforms is extremely time-consuming and daunting for city officials.
type: Knowledge management and sentiment analysis

name: Plovdic City Concierge Chatbot
description: City Concierge is an AI-powered city chatbot like a virtual Tourist Office in the mobile. It is there for the visitors 24/7 in Messenger and provides information about the city Point of Interests – the best to see, do and experience.    It is helpful on-the-go with real-time data about the weather, air quality, exchange calculator and more. Tourists and visitors can search information by category and location, or by keyword, or simply ask question about restaurants, entertainment, sightseeing, shopping, transportation and other
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Chatbot by the Ministry of Education
description: The Danish Ministry of Education is an example of a public authority that receives many inquiries from both institutions and citizens. Therefore, a pilot project will be launched as part of the National Strategy for Artificial Intelligence on use of chatbots by the Ministry of Education. A chatbot could be used in direct contact with citizens, but it could also serve as a support tool for employees who engage in dialogue with citizens.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Chatbot for citizen general service enquiries
description: The municipality of Frederiksberg launched an AI-based chatbot ("Kiri") to answer citizen queries about local services.. When you visit the Frederiksberg Municipality's website you will be able to get help from the chat bot Kiri. It is a digital assistant to whom citizens can ask general questions and answer immediately.  The offer is a trial conducted by Gentofte, Gladsaxe, Lyngby-Taarbæk, Rudersdal, Roskilde and Frederiksberg municipalities, and which is inspired by similar trials with good results in Norway.   Initially, Kiri is an attempt, and initially Kiri will only be able to answer questions in the field of citizen services, such as passports and driver's licenses. Kiri is unable to answer specific cases, but will be able to answer the most typical and general questions.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: A speech recognition system for helping to transcribe the sittings of the Estonian Parliament
description: The speech recognition system helps transcribe the speeches given at the rostrum of the Estonian Parliament (Riigikogu). https://e-estonia.com/hans-ai-support-tool-for-estonian-parliament/?fbclid=IwAR3A-X48Mv5xCCEbr-weRHrM6srVJxDTD25NZ5-e3wZ5P_rC2dXsMUnflfQ The Chancellery of the Riigikogu is currently required to publish a verbatim report within one hour from the end of the sitting. It takes a lot of human effort to do that, and the burden falls on stenographers. By deploying speech recognition, it will increase the efficiency and accuracy in transcripts of the sessions. Also, the plan is to start providing verbatim recordings as machine-readable open data, so other systems can use that data freely as well.
type: Audio processing

name: e-Residency Chatbot
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) customer service assistant for the Republic of Estonia’s e-Residency organisation. Together, we decided to tackle the challenge of increasing customer support response time without hiring additional people. The solution was simple — an artificial intelligence chatbot with a live-chat interface.
type: Audio processing

name: Estonian language speech synthesiser
description: The speech synthesis environment incorporates variations, applications and interfaces of Estonian text to speech synthesis and other materials for synthesis purposes. Speech synthesis is a crucial part of assistive devices for individuals with vision, hearing and speech impairments and in the communication between humans and machines.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Text analysis for removing personal data from documents
description: The Ministry of Education and Research performed a document management audit using the Texta Toolkit, which was aimed at identifying the documents that had been published without authorisation (e.g. internal documents, personal data, etc.). During the audit, more than 1,200,000 documents were analysed, converted into machine-readable form and had the personal data removed. In collaboration with the Centre of Registers and Information Systems, the Ministry of Justice removed, using Texta, personal data from nearly 80,000 court decisions involving information about punishments deleted from the Criminal Records Database and republished the decisions in the Court Information System. Texta Toolkit grew out of industrial research in the Software Technology and Applications Competence Center (STACC) and its development has been supported from the Estonian Language Technology programme.
type: Natural language processing - text mining and speech analytics

name: Detection of anomalies in X-Road / public officials computers
description: The Information System Authority (RIA) uses an AI application to detect anomalies and incidents in our Data Exchange Layer (X-road) monitoring. Essentially, previous data exchange periods are compared with the current one and differences are sought. If the system is unable to identify whether a situation is erroneous or permitted, the system user currently has to decide. Based on the feedback, the system learns how to make better decisions and will be able to detect anomalies and incidents more accurately in the future.
type: Security analytics and threat intelligence

name: Migri.fi Chatbot
description: Migri manages applications for residence permits, citizenship, asylum and reception and  protection, passport issuance and renewal, deportation, and other immigration-related duties and  is located under Finland’s Ministry of the Interior. It is divided into four Substance Units  (Citizenship, Asylum, Residence Permit and Reception Centre) and five Support Units (Legal  and Country Information, Customer Service and Communication, HR, Finance, and Digital  Services). Inland is part of the Digital Services Support Unit, SÄPA (Sähköiset Palvelut). SÄPA  provides advanced technological expertise and is one of the biggest and best IT teams in the  Finnish government (Swan, 2018, p. 38). Residing in SÄPA thus gives Inland a convenient  position from which to combine advanced technology with design thinking. In fact, its  technology-based projects have validated its work within Migri, supporting its organizational  legitimacy (Swan, 2018, p. 119). The nature of this work is well exemplified in their Chatbot  project, which will be explored below.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Kamu
description: Chatbot to answer questions with regard to gaining residence permits to live in Finland based on the Finnish Chatbot Platform
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: VeroBot
description: Chatbot to answer questions with regard to business and work-related taxes in Finland based on the Finnish Chatbot Platform
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Aria
description: National Old Age Insurance Fund (Cnav) is working with "Aria", a chatbot. This chatbot can tell you the amount of income you have declared to the tax authorities, the calendar of next payments, what the direct debit will consist of, etc. , "Aria will be able to speak, will respond to non-retirees and will be able to tackle a larger number of subjects".
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Chatbot Chorus
description: Chatbot has been put in place by the AIFE for users of the information system Chorus of SME's and microbusinesses
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Chatbot CISIRH
description: CISIRH has developed a chatbot specialized in HR management rules to facilitate access. The public service includes a large number of standards, nomenclatures and written rules such as those relating to the mobility of agents and their career development.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: GovBot Verwaltungssuchmaschine NRW
description: GovBot which is in use with the administrative search engine of the administration of the German State North Rhine-Westphalia
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Buddy Krefeld
description: Chatbot to which citizens can ask various questions related to the administrative processes in municipal administrations, for example on which form to fill in for what service. A potentially time saving idea as it does no longer require a civil servant to answer the questions and would offer users real time responses to their queries.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Chatbot for administration helpdesk
description: A chatbot is available in Hungary to help citizens with their cases in public administrations. The chatbot can direct citizens to the correct information, and guide them through the administrative process.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Revenue Chatbot
description: In early 2018, the Irish Revenue Commissioners began investigating the potential of Artificial Intelligence to provide a more efficient, effective experience for customers using their telephony services. A pilot project was initiated to examine if AI based Natural Language Processing (NLP) technologies could be used to deliver an improved customer service, reduce costs and increase efficiencies.    This resulted in the implementation of a Virtual Digital Agent (VDA) or voicebot which was designed to focus on a subset of calls from the Irish taxpayer relating to tax clearance. On a daily basis, taxpayers contact Irish Revenue tax clearance customer support asking how to apply for tax clearance; enquiring what their current tax clearance status is; requesting more information on expired, refused & rescinded tax clearance applications as well as just looking for information on tax clearance itself. The Irish Revenue demonstrated that voicebot technology can offer a fully automated service, providing an efficient, effective experience for customers .https://www.ops2020.gov.ie/actions/innovating-for-our-future/innovation/emerging-technology/artificial-intelligence/revenue-chatbot/     Up to 50% of calls were handled from start to finish by the voicebot.  70% of first-time applicants engaged with the voicebot when submitting their application.  75% of tax clearance holders were able to retrieve their tax clearance access number (TCAN).  Only 10% of calls were transferred due to failure to understand.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: The Dublin Beat
description: The Dublin Beat analyses citizen opinions in the Dublin Region for an overview of their most pressing concerns.Each month public tweets are collated by the AItext analytics platform Citibeats, whose artificial intelligence algorithms have been trained for understanding opinions in the local context of Dublin. This can assist local authorities to better understand how local people feel about civic issues. https://smartdublin.ie/dublin-beat/, https://smartdublin.ie/smart-dublin-explores-how-ai-social-media-can-help-improve-the-city-region/
type: Natural language processing - text mining and speech analytics

name: Toscana Open Research
description: The portal of the Tuscany Region designed to communicate and enhance the Tuscan system of research, innovation and higher education and to promote increasingly transparent and inclusive governance. The integration of data through a domain ontology allows users to query without having to use the technical terminology related to the physical organisation of databases and their complex internal structure.
type: Knowledge management and sentiment analysis

name: TALIA Semantic Framework
description: The TALIA SF is able to extract and organize knowledge coming from the analysis of a huge quantity of textual documents produced by the projects funded by the Interreg MED Programme. This knowledge proves to be invaluable to the management of innovation policies and for the capitalization of the most successful projects results. TALIA semantic framework is handled by Innovapuglia the in-house company of the Regional Government of Apulia.
type: Knowledge management and sentiment analysis

name: Hugo Virtual Asssistant
description: The institution of direct administration under the authority of the Minister for Culture, the Culture Information Systems Centre (hereinafter - KISC), has commenced a single development of a virtual assistant platform of State administration. KISC has created and further developed the language technology platform for public administration, Hugo.lv. The Hugo.lv website provides machine translation, speech recognition and synthesis. National regulatory authorities will have to face challenges when they start using a virtual assistant, as they will have to learn to adapt it to their needs. It should be noted that regulatory frameworks often change and institutions will have to maintain an up-to-date virtual assistant knowledge base. This is a NLP Chatbot for Government which provides SaaP possibility on a shared platform.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Chatbot Toms
description: A Chatbot facilitating customer communication with the State Revenue service (working time, locations, etc.), registration of economic operators, use of the Electronic Declaration System (access facilities, general issues on EDs), annual income statement and eligible expenditure (mandatory submission, types of eligible expenditure, repayment and payment deadlines), as well as the mobile application “Eligible expenditure”.Consulting availability 24/7, freeing employees from answering typical questions.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Automatic decision making of the Electronic Declaration System of the State Revenue Service
description: The Electronic Declaration System of the State Revenue Service shall use the decision-making automating elements by automatically verifying the submitted declarations. It allows the approval of a declaration up to 2/3 which does not reveal non-compliance and thus allows experts to devote time only to checking declarations where non-compliance has been detected. In the future, there is great potential for MI solutions that will help to explore the client of public administration by promoting more efficient services for citizens, reducing the shadow economy and money laundering.
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: Chatbot POLI
description: On the initiative of the Ministry of Agriculture, Viticulture and Consumer Protection and in close collaboration with the State Centre for Information Technologies (Centre des technologies de l'information de l’Etat - CTIE), a chatbot, an online conversational robot called POLI (Personal Operator for users of Luxembourgish Institutions), has just been developed.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: AmberScript - Automated speech translation
description: Several Dutch municipalities, like the municipality of Staphorst, have implemented speech recognition model through a company product, AmberScript specialized in speech recognition, for providing automated speech translation coming from municipality council and brining transparency on how decisions are made for the citizens
type: Audio processing

name: Number Plate Recognition
description: The ANPR system uses number plate recognition software for a variety of usages such as paid parking, traffic control, taks avoidance, environmental protection and more. It is used in more than 2000 administrations and is seen as a strong multi-purpose AI application
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: Notificiations public space
description: Notifications provided by citizens on problems in the public space are categorized automatically and send to the responsible department.
type: Natural language processing, text mining and speech analytics

name: Chatbots Norway
description: Several Norwegian Government Agencies and municipalities use chatbots based on AI technology. Most of them are based on technology from either boost.ai or Kindly. Aim is to create a more efficient public sector with better service for citizens.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Generation of synthetic test data for the National Registry
description: The Norwegian Tax Administration is in the process of developing a solution in which machine learning is used to generate rich synthetic test data in a dedicated test environment for the National Registry. The synthetic National Registry will offer synthetic test subjects in addition to simulating events. The objective is to allow enterprises that use information from the National Registry to test their integrations without using authentic personal data in the tests. Make it easier to find correct and comprehensive information about a given subject matter.
type: Machine learning - deep learning

name: Norwegian State Loan fund to improve control with loan payments and identification
description: The Norwegian student loan fund (Lånekassen) has for the first time used artificial intelligence (AI) to select account controls. It provided twice as many revelations of cheating.    The book check is done among students who state that they live away from home, since only students who do not live with their parents can get the loan back from grants.  Lånekassen’s book check in 2018 included 25,000 students. 15,000 were picked out by artificial intelligence (machine learning), while 10,000 were picked out by random selection (control group). The results showed that artificial intelligence made it easier to find those who are not really living away from home, said the Loan Fund.    ‘’5.5% in the control group and 11.6% in the machine learning group did not pass the book check. It shows that the machine learning selection has been twice as effective as the random selection in finding students who have given us incorrect information about housing
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: Voicebots in government
description: Within the government, there are a number of Voicebots already in place.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Canard Speed Camera System
description: EU financed system allows speed cameras installed at road junctures to derive information from the photographs and flag potential traffic rules infringement. The decision to fine the driver is not automatic, the system serves rather as an initial sorting mechanism that makes the work of CANARD employees more efficient.
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: Sigma
description: Some public administrations are experimenting to deliver services with chatbots. For Portuguese residents, it is possible to change their official address via chatbot Sigma. The provision of services in the informative phase is through the services and entities catalog (CES - Catálogo de Entidades e Serviços). The information structure follows standards from Core Vocabularies (CV/CPSV) and is provided by the portal through integration of services.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Antonia
description: The City Hall of Cluj has an AI system called Antonia, which handles the automatic processing of 64 types of forms for requesting public services. The also has a chatbot component so she can answer questions about how to fill the forms. https://www.romaniajournal.ro/society-people/antonia-the-first-virtual-public-servant-in-romania/ . In the second development stage of the AI-based technology, Antonia will become a hologram, this being the surprise-element for the next stage. This depends on how fast we will work out the technical aspects, so there is no time estimation for the complete implementation," according o the local officials in Cluj-Napoca. The project is estimated to be completed within 30 months' period. Antonia has been launched in April 2018 and functions around the clock.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Chatbot Taxana
description: Everyone needs a helping hand when talking about taxes. Even your accountant. We have created an amazing Chatbot for Financial Administration Slovak republic. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UQ_XRlIFtrQ
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Chatbot Alfi
description: The Alfi Chatbot is part of a government initiative to stop the bureaucracy in Slovakia and to apply the once only principle in a digital way. The Chatbot has been invented in order to help find the best solutions and answers to common questions for the general public.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: CHEST
description: Busines Intelligence platform/ Gathering data from different sources in data repository to provide BI reports. Same data repository can be used also for data needed in AI models training
type: Machine learning - deep learning

name: Catagory Tester
description: This AI system is used in the Slovenian tendering processes in order to vertify whether the tender object is well categorized. Should lead to better and more trustworthy statistics.
type: Natural language processing - text mining and speech analytics

name: Chatbot Sant Just Desvern
description: The City Council of Sant Just Desvern, a Catalan municipality in the Bajo Llobregat region with 17,200 inhabitants, has presented a chatbot with which this administration aims to streamline its processes and boost relations with its citizens.The first two available chatbots will take care of:        - the previous appointments of the City Council, so that waits will be reduced        - the management of the registration flyers
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: 060 Service
description: This is a NLP service to answer FAQ and to translate formal public administration terms into more informal terms for citizens. The 060 line is announced in 2006 with a certain objective, being the center point of attention for the Spanish citizens, in order to provide information regarding the Central Administration Services and to connect the different public servicesthrough one short number, 060.
type: Natural language processing - text mining and speech analytics

name: Skatti
description: Chatbot that can answer questions from the tax payer about taxation/ Better service to the tax payer
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Tengai
description: The Upplands-Bro municipality, located outside Stockholm,is the first in the country to use robots to interview job candidates. Tengai the robot, the brainchild of Furhat Robotics, has been created with a goal of ensuring discrimination-free recruitment.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: AI in Swedish Land Registry
description: The Swedish Land Registry (SLR) needed to increase their efficiency when dealing with land registry requests. They now use AI to read and modernise documents. Many old, handwritten documents cannot be digitised with ease as it is hard to read the tekst. AI assist in reading these documents.
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: Voice-based e-government services
description: A project has started in the City of St. Gallen to create a functional prototype of a voice-based civil service capable of conversing with citizens. Conversation-based interfaces and corresponding voice assistants for handling electronic citizen services are also extremely promising for e-government services. Expectations with regard to “Conversational E-Government” include, for example, a conscious reduction in the complexity of the services offered and improved accessibility for all citizens. https://www.fhsg.ch/de/projekte/project/conego-217/
type: Audio processing

name: Programm DaziT Evaluation einer Chatbot Lösung
description: In order to reduce the effort caused by crossing borders (especially in the employee area), a very high degree of process automation is aimed for. A chatbot solution is currently being evaluated in the Federal Customs Administration as part of the DaZit program
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Chatbot Canton of Zug
description: A chatbot is available on the website of the Zug Commercial Register and Bankrupty Office. The digital administration assistant supports you, for example, with the ordering of commercial register extracts and receipts, with the entry of a sole proprietorship by filling out the form, or by putting together a claim entry together with a user and sending a finished PDF for forwarding to the Office produces. The aim is to meet a freely formulated need of the customers of the Commercial Register and Bankruptcy Office in Zug as well and as quickly as possible within the scope of the defined skills. https://www.zg.ch/behoerden/volkswirtschaftsdirektion/handelsregisteramt/aktuell/medienmitteilung-chatbot
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Chatbot of the cantonal social security institution SVA
description: In the Canton of St. Gallen, a Chatbot has been developed in the SVA organization to provide information for citizens about their services https://www.leaderdigital.ch/news/sva-will-chatbot-angebot-ausbauen-2718.html
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Automated mail procesing Kanton Aargau
description: The Social Insurance Aargau SVA has introduced the Maxi Chatbot in order to reduce the number of questions received daily. The chatbot can answer general questions without sensitive data content. In the future, all further emails should run through automated and intelligent (learning) triage and further processing. To do this, requests with personal data must be correctly triaged by the chatbot and, depending on the type of request, directly trigger a process on the specialist application. With the introduction of the "Maxi" chatbot, remedial measures were taken and mail inquiries reduced by around 30%. https://www.previon.ch/projekte/maxi-der-clevere-chatbot-der-sva-aargau
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Chatbot City of St..Gallen
description: Using a prototype, the city of St.Gallen tested the potential and acceptance of a chatbot in order to offer residents and tourism better access to information and services from the administration.   By the end of 2018, various topics had been mapped in the chatbot. This includes the event calendar, information on parking spaces, the query of mobility information, the use of eUmzugCH, the query of information on disposal and the input of feedback to the programmers.   The implementation in its own software environment, more extensive dialog options, the connection to the residence confirmation, the debt enforcement register extract and the extension of the deadline in the area of ​​taxes will take place in 2019. Linked to this is the public test of the chatbot and subsequently a revision based on the knowledge gained from the public test. https://www.egovernment.ch/de/dokumentation/webpublikation/projekte/leistungen-fur-die-bevolkerung/chatbot-fur-die-offentliche-verwaltung/     The bot will be integrated in the urban app (mobileSG) and on the city's website towards the end of 2019.     In addition to low-threshold access to basic administrative services, the chatbot project in particular made it possible to open up existing systems and specialist procedures and to provide interfaces for scalable use of the bot in other cities and municipalities.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Plausibilitätsprüfung mit Machine Learn-ing
description: This project intends to extend and accelerate the plausibility checks in the BFS using machine learning algorithms while increasing the data quality. Data that appears to be either clearly wrong or at least questionable will be sent back to the data providers with a request for correction or comment. Until now, such plausibility checks were mostly carried out in two different ways: either by manual controls or by automated procedures using limit values ​​and logical tests. This process of mutual plausi checks is very labor intensive. Machine learning can help to carry out the controls more quickly and more precisely.https://www.experimental.bfs.admin.ch/de/data-validation.html
type: Machine learning - deep learning

name: Amelia CitizenBot
description: Last month, amid budget cuts, the Enfield council in north London became the first government to employ Amelia, an avatar and chatbot personal assistant from IPsoft. Amelia uses artificial intelligence, machine-learning algorithms, and a natural language processor to help local residents find city services.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Unemployment categorization
description: As of 2020, the Public Employment Service Austria (AMS) makes use of algorithmic profiling of job seekers to increase the efficiency of its counseling process and the effectiveness of active labor market programs. Based on a statistical model of job seekers' prospects on the labor market, the system—that has become known as the AMS algorithm—is designed to classify clients of the AMS into three categories: those with high chances to find a job within half a year, those with mediocre prospects on the job market, and those clients with a bad outlook of employment in the next 2 years. Depending on the category a particular job seeker is classified under, they will be offered differing support in (re)entering the labor market https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fdata.2020.00005/full A coalition of civil society organizations started a campaign to rescind an algorithm used by Austria’s employment agency https://amsalgorithmus.at/
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: Using profiling based on machine-learning software to efficiently bring together employers and job seekers
description: The Estonian Unemployment Insurance Fund uses profiling to identify the position that suits a job seeker the most. Based on machine-learning software, the solution assists people by suggesting job positions according to their qualifications. The application provides job seekers with better and more accurate suggestions on where they could work.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: LaBonneBoîte
description: Predict the probability that a firm will hire in the next months to help to encourage unsolicited application/ "https://labonne boite.pole emploi.fr/" "Improve the probability that  unemployed people find a job"
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: algorithm to track down illegal holiday lets
description: Amsterdam city officials have been given the green light to experiment with using algorithms to track down people illegally renting out their homes via platforms such as Airbnb. The algorithm will include information about previous housing fraud and information from the city’s population registries. ‘We already analyse this information, but it is done by hand,’ Bolkestein said. ‘The algorithms can do this better and more quickly.’ According to a city press release, the algorithm will analyse how likely it is that fraud is involved at a given address. ‘If the chance is more than 50%, then an official will give priority to that address,’ the statement said.
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: Debt Alert
description: AI which helps identify people with the risk of debt. Part of the LivingLab together with the Dutch CJIB. As a pilot, the CJIB sent 400 drivers without vehicle insurance a folder with the message: insure your vehicle and pay the fine before it gets worse. Is that not possible or are there any questions? Then you can call the aforementioned phone number. The flyer has a clear layout, a lot of image and little text. A big difference  with the penitent letter that offenders get through the letterbox.
type: Machine learning - deep learning

name: SyRi
description: The Dutch government’s risk indication system (SyRI) is a risk calculation model developed over the past decade by the social affairs and employment ministry to predict the likelihood of an individual committing benefit or tax fraud or violating labour laws. Deployed primarily in low-income neighbourhoods, it gathers government data previously held in separate silos, such as employment, personal debt and benefit records, and education and housing histories, then analyses it using a secret algorithm to identify which individuals might be at higher risk of committing benefit fraud. A Dutch court has ordered the immediate halt of an automated surveillance system for detecting welfare fraud because it violates human rights.
type: Security analytics and threat intelligence

name: AI against sexual abuse
description: there is usage of AI is in the search and detection of content leading to sexual abuse of children. This tool both reduces the psychological damage of staff searching for these files as well as enabling the government to react as fast as possible to these situations.
type: Cognitive robotics and process automation - connected and automated vehicles

name: Predicting long term unemployment
description: This project builds upon unemployment data held by the public employment service with additional data sources in order to produce a score reflecting the risk of a person to become long term unemployment (12 months or longer). This will enable the agency to tailor actions to this person.
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: LIDAR
description: In 2016, a direct administration body under the supervision of the Minister for Justice, the State Land Service (hereinafter - VZD), in cooperation with the Rezekne Technology Academy (hereinafter - ROAS), carried out a pilot project using LIDAR (Light Detection And Ranging) for capacity recognition. Aero-scanning is a remote-imaging technology that measures the distance from the aircraft-mounted scanner to the target with laser pulse and analyzes the reflected light) data within which the ROAS processed LIDAR data in two areas. Following the closure of the pilot project, the work has not continued, but the solution has an outlook.
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: VDI: Protection of digital infrastructure
description: The existing early warning system for digital infrastructure has been used to detect targeted cyber attacks for almost 20 years. The Norwegian National Security Authority is now developing new sensor technology that will build on and eventually replace the sensors used in the existing early warning system. A new platform will be developed to use artificial intelligence and machine learning on the data collected. The platform will enable automatic analysis of any malware detected as well as automatic sharing of results. Better cyber security for critical infrastructure
type: Security analytics and threat intelligence

name: Speed cameras for detecting speeding violations
description: Probably one of the most “visible” types of AI applications in Estonia are the speed cameras developed by an Estonian company Datel, which identify the license plate number on the photos of speeding cars using a machine learning algorithm. Based on the license plate number identified, the system finds the data required to conduct procedural acts, assesses the causality of speeding and imposes a penalty if necessary. Then the Police and Border Guard Board official conducting the proceedings verifies the data and signs the operation.
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: Robot judge
description: The most ambitious project to date, the Estonian Ministry of Justice has asked Velsberg and his team to design a “robot judge” that could adjudicate small claims disputes of less than €7,000 (about $8,000). Officials hope the system can clear a backlog of cases for judges and court clerks.  The project is in its early phases and will likely start later this year with a pilot focusing on contract disputes. In concept, the two parties will upload documents and other relevant information, and the AI will issue a decision that can be appealed to a human judge. Many details are still to be worked out. Velsberg says the system might have to be adjusted after feedback from lawyers and judges.  Estonia’s effort isn’t the first to mix AI and the law, though it may be the first to give an algorithm decision-making authority.
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: OpenJustice
description: The Court of Cassation , in conjunction with the Ministry of Justice, wishes to develop automatic learning techniques in order to identify the data to be pseudonymized in court decisions before making them accessible and reusable. The results of this work will profoundly transform the dissemination of case law, strengthen the consistency of decisions rendered and citizens' confidence in the judiciary; they can be widely applied to other types of data.This machine learning model to automatically pseudonymize case law data and foster open data of case law.https://entrepreneur-interet-general.etalab.gouv.fr/defis/2019/openjustice.html . Aims to foster open data and the development of legal tech start ups
type: Natural language processing - text mining and speech analytics

name: Fraud detection value declarations
description: A supervised deep mining algorithm is used by French customs in order to detect fraud with value delcrations and to analyze cases of identiy fraud or import trafficiking
type: Security analytics and threat intelligence

name: Refugee Language Detection
description: Germany's Federal Office for Migrants and Refugees uses avoice recognition software that seeks to identify which country migrants without documentation are from. The Federal Office for Migrants and Refugees said the automated new system would begin within two weeks. But it will not be ready for routine use for at least a year and there are doubts over its effectiveness. The aim is to detect Arabic-speaking migrants claiming to be Syrian to increase their chances of asylum. Linguists argue it would be impossible for an automatic machine to be completely accurate, as language and vocabulary are ever-changing. The new software will run alongside techniques already in use to establish a person's identity. A variety of data will be examined, including the asylum-seeker's documentation, before a final decision is made. If necessary, officials will also seek expert opinion.
type: Audio processing

name: Automation HRM and Court of Justice Information System
description: In 2017, a direct administration under the authority of the Minister for Justice, the Court administration carried out a pilot project process for automation, which underlines the process of billing transfer between the Horizon resource management system and the Court of Justice Information System, replacing human work with a programmatic robot. The costs of developing and implementing the system totalled EUR 9000.
type: Cognitive robotics and process automation - connected and automated vehicles

name: Forecasting legal deadlines
description: In 2018, the judicial administration actively participated in the development of forecasting models for legal deadlines, which, through machine learning and neuron chains, forecasted the deadlines and produced ten different models, applied in practice. The development of the deadline forecast tool took place in the framework of a challenge organised by the University of Latvia (hereinafter - LU) Innovation Centre, where several teams successfully developed a number of machine-trained models, using the data provided by the Court administration on cases and the deadlines for examining them, which forecast the deadlines for proceedings.
type: Machine learning - deep learning

name: FCIS H2020
description: Lithuanian Customs https://lrmuitine.lt/web/guest/titulinis#en or Financial Crime Investigations Service http://www.fntt.lt/en/ are using machine learning to identify suspicious patterns (trade, financial flows)    FCIS is part of H2020 project (http://www.fntt.lt/lt/ivykiai/fntt-kartu-su-partneriais-pradeda-igyvendinti-europos-sajungos-moksliniu-tyrimu-ir-inovaciju-lesomis-remiama-projekta/3768), which, among other things will explore using AI for better processing and analysis of data. The project, implemented in Lithuania, will aim to apply artificial intelligence, data analysis and data visualization methods over two years, allowing law enforcement professionals to link, prioritize and analyze information gathered from different sources to facilitate decision-making. Several structural units of the FNTT will be directly involved in the development of a targeted data processing and analysis system.
type: Machine learning - deep learning

name: Forensic Screening of Cold Cases
description: The police in the Netherlands is learning a machine to do forensic screening. The goal is that the AI can read cold cases we’re currently digitizing, and decide which ones contain promising evidence that could lead to solving the case.
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: The Burglary Predictor
description: In the municipality of Utrecht, Xomnia has built a model that predicts the occurrence of burglaries in each district of Utrecht for a given week. From the date and time of the burglary, we derived weather conditions, holidays and special events. Sociodemographic statistics of the neighborhoods have been derived, as well as certain points of interest, like street lights, cameras, trees, parks and large garbage containers. The Burglary Predictor built by Xomnia enables the municipality of Utrecht to prevent burglaries by data-driven decision making.
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: Rijkswaterstaat - Machine learning for road accident predictions
description: The densely connected road network in the Netherlands is severely impacted by road accidents with high human, economic and environmental consequences. Road accidents result in 600 deaths per year, and traffic jams that may result from accidents cause an estimated € 2.7 billion loss in productivity per year. The division of the Netherlands Ministry of Water and Infrastructure Management, Rijkswaterstaat (RWS) operates a 24 hour incident management service to ensure the safety and mobility of emergency response workers, and to regulate and restore traffic flow in the event of an accident.    The growing number of accidents in the Netherlands highways is creating increased pressure on traffic managers and inspectors. Traffic managers must process real-time data from 15+ screens, increasing the chances of an accident being missed. Traffic inspectors need to ensure they are optimally positioned in their deployment zone to minimize travel time to accident sites.    This year Data Science for Social Good has been working with Rijkswaterstaat to create a machine learning model using data from incidents recorded between 2012 to 2016, road characteristics, speed and flow traffic data and weather data. The model predicts within a given time window and road segment the probability of an accident. Overlaying this on a heatmap we are able to display to traffic managers the road sections with the highest likelihood of accidents. This will allow them to better allocate inspectors to road sections to patrol. Using this model gives a 3 to 4 times improvement on a baseline, where traffic inspectors patrol random road segments.
type: Knowledge management and sentiment analysis

name: Crime Anticipation System (CAS)
description: The Crime Anticipation System (CAS) makes weekly analyzes based on local and current data. External data about neighborhoods and residents, for example, is supplemented by the police's own knowledge about crimes and local situations and information from Statistics Netherlands. The system searches for crimes that show a pattern - for example, bicycle thefts in a certain neighborhood happen most often between the hours of 9:00 p.m. and midnight. Based on that, the police can better deploy available resources to fight these crimes more effectively, according to the news wire.
type: Security analytics and threat intelligence

name: Law enforcement optimization system
description: For the municipality of Amsterdam, Xomnia built a user-friendly dashboard to optimize law enforcement. Xomnia harvested data from 7 entirely different data sources stored in the municipality’s data silos, such as GPS data from walkie-talkies and text data from fines collected by PDA’s and control room reports. The data was reconstructed and interconnected to enable dynamic data exploring for creating the dashboard.
type: Security analytics and threat intelligence

name: Face recognition Bucharest Airport
description: A facial recognition system will be implemented in bucharest Airport. The AI will be capable of both identifying wanted persons, terrorism subjects or others on the list of intelligence services as well as a solution which detects suspicious behaviour. https://www.uti.eu.com/press-releases/uti-will-implement-face-recognition-and-intelligent-image-analysis-systems-with-otopeni-airport/
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: Metrici LPR cameras
description: An AI system used for analysing cameras on the most heavy traffic route of Romania has been installed for better license plate detection. https://metrici.ro/cases/rm-valcea
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: VeriPol
description: Developed by scientists in Wales and Spain, the tool can reportedly spot if somebody has filed a fake police statement based on the text included in the document.    Using automatic text analysis and advanced machine learning techniques, the tool is said to have identified false robbery reports with over 80 per cent accuracy.    The tool has now been rolled out across Spain to help support police officers and indicate where further investigations are necessary.    VeriPol is specific to reports of robbery and can recognise patterns that are more common with false claims, such as the types of items reported stolen, finer details of incidents and descriptions of a perpetrator.    The research team, which included computer science experts from Cardiff University and Charles III University of Madrid, believe the tool could save the police time and effort by complementing traditional investigative techniques, whilst also deterring people from filing fake statements in the first place. The results of the study have been published in Knowledge-Based Systems.
type: Natural language processing - text mining and speech analytics

name: Swiss State Secretariat for Migration
description: Switzerland is embracing innovation in its response to the global refugee crisis. Beginning this fall, the Swiss State Secretariat for Migration will test a new, data-driven method for assigning asylum seekers to cantons across the country. Asylum seekers in the pilot program will be assessed by an algorithm designed to maximize their chances of finding a job.   The algorithm will allow officials to send individuals to the canton that best fits their profile, rather than allocate them randomly, as under the current system.  The program will then follow these asylum seekers over the next several years, comparing their employment rates to those of others who entered the country at the same time. It will include two thousand people, half placed in cantons with the guidance of the algorithm and half placed randomly.   The algorithm’s recommendations take into account constraints such as the limited space in a canton, and placement officials make the final decision in each case.  The placement algorithm was developed by the Immigration Policy Lab (IPL), which has branches at Stanford University and ETH Zurich, and an affiliated researcher from Dartmouth College. IPL researchers aimed to give countries around the world a tool to improve refugee integration that could easily be implemented, at low cost and without overhauling their existing systems. Their first step: harnessing many years of underused data on refugees and their outcomes. https://www.srf.ch/news/schweiz/jobs-fuer-fluechtlinge-algorithmus-verteilt-neu-asylbewerber-auf-kantone
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: PRECOPS Predictive policing
description: Since 2012, the Zurich City Police and 3 other cantons have been using have been using software that predicts burglaries. This reduced the number of burglaries by 60% between 2012 and 2016. This corresponds to savings of CHF 13 million in insurance annually. However, the use of the software remains controversial with limited clear benefits from its usage. Cities which have been using the PRECOPS software found similiar decreases in burglaries since the introduction of the software as similiar cantons. https://algorithmwatch.org/en/story/swiss-predictive-policing/ In one of the cantons, Aargau, there were now so few burglaries in their dataset which makes the predictions of the system very inaccurate https://www.srf.ch/news/regional/aargau-solothurn/aargauer-polizei-software-opfer-des-eigenen-erfolges
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: HARM
description: The Harm Assessment Risk Tool (HART) puts information on a person’s past offending history, age, postcode and other background characteristics through algorithms that then classify them as a low, medium or high risk.
type: Security analytics and threat intelligence

name: Predictive policing
description: Kent Police began its predictive policing pilot in December 2012, it started by feeding data, including five years' worth of recorded crimes and three years of incidents of anti-social behaviour, into a computer.
type: Security analytics and threat intelligence

name: ILVO AI Experiments
description: The Institute for Agricultural, Fisheries and Food Research (ILVO) evaluated the possibilities of artificial intelligence for agricultural applications. Most applications are still in an initial phase and often in collaboration with other knowledge centers. Some concrete projects are: o Processing of hyperspectral images for early detection of potato diseases o Automatic health monitoring in cattle (e.g. lameness detection) o Automatic health monitoring in fattening pigs o Image analysis for multiple specific applications (e.g. quality food products, sorting fish species, etc.) o Behavior of plants under the influence of external stimuli o Identification of problem insects (eg zip needles) via camera images o Site-specific detection of problem weeds
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: PaveAI
description: VISITFLANDERS has there an experiment with PaveAI. This includes one tool that interprets the figures in Google Analytics via machine learning and custom reports. This will be applied to the website flemishmasters.com.ent.be/pfile?id=1356741
type: Machine learning - deep learning

name: Detection of business fraud
description: A project by the Danish Business Authority (Erhvervsstyrelsen) to use ML to identify fraud and highlight material errors in financial statements.
type: Security analytics and threat intelligence

name: SATIKAS
description: In the Estonian Agricultural Registers and Information Board (ARIB), Artificial Intelligence is used in order to detect whether the agricultural grasslands have been mowed or not. This system, called SATIKAS , uses the satellite data coming from the European COPERNICUS programme to automatically detect whether mowing has taken place on the Estonian grasslands.
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: A machine vision application to identify the traffic load within Tallinn
description: The Tallinn transport department, responsible for organising public transport and traffic in Tallinn, started developing a machine vision application in autumn 2018 in collaboration with Sifr OÜ. The main objective of this application is to identify the traffic load within Tallinn, i.e. how many cars drive in and out of the city in a day in order to make city transport planning related decisions based on such data (e.g. parking issues, road construction, etc.). Three cameras were selected on intersections in Tallinn to train the application to count the vehicles passing by the cameras. The training of the application was a crucial process in developing the solution since there was no ready-made solution available that suited the circumstances of Tallinn. The result is an application that uses machine vision to count buses, cars, lorries and motorcycles and in the future hopefully also pedestrians, cyclists and like.The result was information with a near 70% accuracy on the traffic load in a certain area when previously there no such information available at all. The accuracy of the results is affected by weather conditions, dirt on the camera lens, etc. Regardless, the results are a valuable milestone for the city for expanding the use of machine vision to other hundreds of city traffic cameras.
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: PatRek
description: Chatbot to answer questions with regard to setting up a company in in Finland based on the Finnish Chatbot Platform
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: 3rdhandrobot.eu
description: This project aims at developing a semi-autonomous robot assistant that acts as a third hand for a human worker
type: Cognitive robotics and process automation - connected and automated vehicles

name: IA Flash
description: The Ministry of the Interior through its National Agency for the Automated Processing of Crimes wishes to develop an artificial intelligence enabling photos of automated checks to be associated with vehicle registration data in order to reduce the sending of notices of contraventions to users having committed no offense. This AI aims to detect car models to limit the number of reports sent erroneously after a flash radar. Aim to reduce number of wrong reports. https://entrepreneur-interet-general.etalab.gouv.fr/defis/2019/iaflash.html
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: SignauxFaibles
description: predicting companies in difficulty in order to support them for better industrial policy. https://beta.gouv.fr/startups/signaux-faibles.html
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: TRAMAN21
description: It is the main objective of TRAMAN21 to develop the foundations and first steps that will pave the way towards a new era of future motorway traffic management research and practice, which is indispensable in order to accompany, complement and exploit the evolving VACS deployment. TRAMAN21 assesses the relevance of VACS for improved traffic flow and develops specific options for a sensible upgrade of the traffic conditions, particularly at the network’s weak points, i.e. at bottlenecks and incident locations. The proposed work comprises the development of new traffic flow modelling and control approaches, on the basis of appropriate methods from many-particle Physics, Automatic Control and Optimisation, to consider and exploit the novel vehicle capabilities at a network-wide level. A field trial is included, aiming at a preliminary testing and demonstration of the developed concepts.
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: Smart Planner
description: The system released with Apache 2.0 license, is based on AI automatic planning techniques and is able to suggest users who connect through an app from their smartphone the fastest and most ecological solutions to reach a specific destination in the city . Through the analysis of data intercepted from multiple sources, the app gives personalized indications on which public, private or shared means of transport should be used to reduce polluting emissions and travel times. the Smart Planner solution is reported to have been in use in the cities of Trento and Rovereto as well as the Emilia Romagna region.
type: Machine learning - deep learning

name: VARIS
description: The Rural Support Service (“LAD”) uses the virtual assistant “VARIS”. The “VARIS” shall review all aid applicants in the LAD database, then obtain information about the responsible persons of the company in the Lursoft database. The register of penalties “VARIS” shall check that the beneficiary has not been penalised. The resulting information “VARIS” shall be inserted into the LAD database.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Future assistant for entrepreneurs (FAE)
description: On 13 June 2018, the Enterprise Register revealed the first virtual assistant of public administration in Latvia - UNA. A virtual assistant in Latvian and English shall provide answers in writing to the most frequently asked questions regarding the registration of a new entity, the direction of the registration documents submitted and the liquidation. The virtual assistant to the Enterprise Register, UNA, is a customer-oriented tool that is available at any time of the day and uses an understandable and simple communication style at the same time. A virtual assistant, UNA, has been developed in the framework of a pilot project in seven months, with five team members. The Enterprise Register, when implementing a virtual assistant project, makes communication with the customer more accessible and friendly, does not require customers to go face-to-face to customer service centers, saving their time and money, without having to wait for a conversation with the Enterprise Register operator in the call center, because answers to customer questions are provided immediately. A virtual assistant to the Enterprise Register also enables employees of the institution to replace technical routine work, allowing employees to focus on higher added-value work, where, for example, emotional engagement is also needed, which the virtual assistant cannot replace.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: FITS (Future Intelligent Transport Systems) ITEMS
description: Recognizing car numbers for driving speed, ensurance and roadworthiness test control on roads/ At the end of 2018, the number of road accidents decreased by 43% compared to the number prior to the installation of photo cameras (1 084, after 613) at the roadside stages where photo cameras were installed and operated.
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: FITS AEMS
description: The State Public Traffic Safety Directorate (hereinafter “CSDD”) uses the FITS (“Future Future Transport Systems”) AEMS, which significantly improves road safety and saves people's lives. FITS LABS provides uniform management and processing of sensors and data in the transport sector, taking advantage of the latest cloud computing and MI. As part of the project, data collected by various sensors from many manufacturers is collected in one place. Collecting and managing them teaches your computer to “understand” transport flows and events. For example, in photographs provided by Latvian speed cameras, identify vehicles by identifying their characteristics, recognizing the number marks, etc.At the end of 2018, the number of road accidents decreased by 43% compared to the number prior to the installation of photo cameras (1 084, after 613) at the roadside stages where photo cameras were installed and operated. On the other hand, the number of road deaths decreased by 87% (32 people died before the accounting period, 4 during the photo radar period). In the country as a whole, the number of road deaths has decreased from 184 to 148 since 2014, i.e. by 20%. During this period, traffic intensity has increased by 15-20% on the national road network. According to the Latvian Vehicle Insurers Bureau (“LTAB”), the creation of a network of photo radars throughout Latvia is an effective tool to limit speeding in daily life, thereby also contributing to improving traffic safety. A survey conducted by the LTAB concluded that 30% of drivers who prefer to exceed the speed limit are reducing it before photo radars. It should be noted that the introduction of photo radars is not the only factor that has a positive impact on changes in road safety.
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: Preventive protection of black ice
description: There are AI tools used in order to predict and prevent black ice. The AI detects and predicts within 2-3 hours where there be black ice in these areas, so preventice actions can be taken
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: AI in I fix Vilnius
description: AI-based solutions are being considered as the possible next step for “I fix Vilnius” application.
type: Machine learning - deep learning

name: Chatbot RVO for manure regulation
description: Chatbot which helps to support farms in understanding the regulation for manure.http://www.cssi-motion.eu/_media/content/pilot-mestbeleid-watson-rvo.pdf
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: self-driving snowploughs
description: ​For air traffic to run smoothly, the runways must be totally free from snow. Avinor has, through an innovative procurement process, tested and purchased a system for autonomous snow ploughs at its airports. The system is called Yeti and is developed by the Kongsberg based company Yeti Snow Technology. More efficient snow removal - better service.
type: Cognitive robotics and process automation - connected and automated vehicles

name: Prognose for feil i strømnettet
description: forecast service for weather dependent failures on power lines. https://datascience.statnett.no/2018/04/27/from-idea-to-deployment-a-service-for-estimation-of-failure-probability-on-overhead-lines-based-on-the-current-weather-forecast/
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: Insolvency Predicition
description: The TrondHeim Municipality was working on an AI system capable of predicting which companies had a higher chance of become insolvent. This enable the organsisation to detect companies at risk at take pre-emptive actions. The predictions were accurate to around 80% a year, but an accuracy of 90% would have been much more preferred
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: Profiling of the unemployed
description: Automated decision making system introduced by the Polish Ministry of Labour and Social Policy to profile unemployed / benefit-seeking citizens, and assign them to one of the three categories that determine the type of assistance that a person can obtain from local labour offices.
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: Clearance Chamber ICT System
description: A complex risk indicator that collects financial data from financial institutions to determine whether account holders conduct illegal activities. If the suspicious activity is detected, at the request of the tax authorities the bank will be able to freeze suspicious accounts. The system is run by the State Clearance Chamber, a key entity of the Polish payment system infrastructure, that renders complex clearing services and other bank services.
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: AIA Chatbot
description: Developed a chatbot (Note) that allows businesses to consult about necessary approvals and procedures when starting up a business
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Failstopper
description: The project, called 'FailStopper' and launched earlier this month, aims, through sensors, to study the compressed air system of the vehicle (installed on the roof) which, according to the researcher, allows the "performance of the secondary suspension", an element responsible for "keeping the vehicle level with station platforms". Researchers from the Institute of Systems and Computers Engineering, Technology and Science (INESC TEC), in Porto, launched a project that aims to "combat and anticipate leveling failures" of Metro do Porto vehicles. The 'FailStopper' project was one of the 15 projects approved in the Scientific Research and Technological Development contest in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence in Public Administration, an initiative of the Foundation for Science and Technology (FCT) that joins the Ministry of Science, Technology and Higher Education and the Ministry of Administrative Modernization.
type: Cognitive robotics and process automation - connected and automated vehicles

name: Automation of NOGA coding - NOGauto
description: The employees responsible for the NOGA coding assign or control the codes of the economic activity of the companies based on the available information (input from surveys, description of the economic activity in the commercial register, etc.). This is inevitably coupled with a human and therefore subjective interpretation of the available information, which makes standardized coding difficult. Development of a tool that can automatically assign the corresponding NOGA codes to the companies registered in the BUR. With automatic coding, at least the same or even higher quality should be achieved than with the current manual coding by the NOGA Group.
type: Cognitive robotics and process automation - connected and automated vehicles

name: TFL TravelBot
description: The new social media tool, which is powered by artificial intelligence, can "chat" with customers using Messenger and instantly tell them when their bus is due to arrive, provide service updates and Tube maps. The TravelBot can also link direct to a customer service agent, making customer service queries easier than ever.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: AI for water quality
description: The Water Development Department in Cyprus is using AI algorithms for the analysis of water monitoring data (such as hydraulics and water quality).
type: Machine learning - deep learning

name: Optimisation of the drinking water system in the city of Aarhus
description: https://www.aquatechtrade.com/news/article/video-story-digital-denmark/
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: AI for more flexible and secure electricity supply
description: Danish electricity consumption fluctuates depending on time of year and time of day. By analysing consumption patterns, utility companies can adjust production according to demand, thereby saving resources. In the UK, the UK National Grid and DeepMind have developed a solution which can reduce energy consumption by up to 10%
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: Chain
description: Sensors analyse the water consumption in order to optimise energy consumption
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: IAlim
description: Refine the targeting of establishments to be inspected in the direct-to-consumer delivery sector (restaurants, food service businesses, distributors) through consumer feedback on online notification sites. AIm to have better notifications https://www.etalab.gouv.fr/intelligence-artificielle-decouvrez-les-6-projets-laureats-de-lappel-a-manifestation-dinteret-ia
type: Natural language processing - text mining and speech analytics

name: Rotterdam – Improving the usage of rooftops
description: The Municipality of Rotterdam (Gemeente Rotterdam) manages Rotterdam, one of the most modern and touristic cities in the Netherlands, which is inhabited by 600,000 residents. Rotterdam has a unique roof landscape that was created after World War II, where many buildings with flat roofs were built during the city’s reconstruction. There are approximately 14.5km2 of flat roofs in the city and the Municipality of Rotterdam wants to use data to make informed decisions regarding the sustainable usage of its rooftops.  DSSG (Data Science for Social Good) is helping Rotterdam figure out how improved use of its rooftops could help address challenges with water storage, green spaces and energy generation. The principal goal will be to use aerial and satellite images to identify the current usage of rooftops in Rotterdam.
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: Parking ticket collection system
description: This AI uses image recogntion systems on a car which scans the license plates of surrounding cars parked in the area. The number plate is then scanned in the database whether the parking spot has been paid for.
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: Artificial Intelligence for Detail Planning (AIDA)
description: In order to faster digitize Sweden's existing detail plans and get closer to a national plan database, the project will develop and implement an artificial intelligence in the work of interpreting detail plan regulations according to the National Board of Housing, Building and Planning's standard. faster digitize Sweden's existing detail plans and Creation of a national database
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: An AI-model for the water mains network (in collaboration with Digital Demo Stockholm (DDS))
description: Test-Project to evaluate possibilities with risk aversion of maintainance and planning. Better predictions regarding areas and specific mains likely to suffer leakages
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: Detection batch numbers vaccins
description: Child and Family has a proof of concept regarding recognition and reading of lot numbers on vaccine packages via the camera of a smartphone. Lot numbers on vaccine packages are not standardized. The goal is to make it easier to store the lot number at the vaccination registration, so that it can always be found afterwards with what specific fate a child was vaccinated.
type: Computer vision and identity recognition

name: Project Verontrustingen
description: In 2014, the Flemish Agency for Child and Family (Kind & Gezin) started a pilot project to use advanced data analytics to create a predictive model to detect day-care services which require further inspection . Child and Familiy is an independent agency tasked with improving the well-being of young children and their families by executing the policy plans developed by the Flemish Ministry.
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: Andrija
description: Andrija is a virtual assistant powered by artificial intelligence and has been developed by Croatian IT companies in cooperation with epidemiologists to advise people on how to diagnose and manage suspected COVID-19 infections. The digital assistant is available at https://andrija.ai/ and can be activated on WhatsApp under the name Andrija. https://www.croatiaweek.com/croatia-launches-its-first-covid-19-digital-assistant/
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Corti - Emergency medical services real-time speech analysis for cardiac predictions
description: Corti’s system is an Artificial Intelligence-based speech analysis of real-time, live emergency medical services calls that makes instant predictions to detect out-of-hospital cardiac arrests… with up to 95% accuracy. Used in conjunction with human call-takers and dispatchers, it can significantly reduce error rates and make critical diagnoses faster.  The system is already up and running in Copenhagen with impressive results – which is why The European Emergency Number Association (EENA) is getting involved to extend the project. This project is a year-long joint initiative between Corti and EENA to pilot AI support to improve emergency medical service operations.
type: Audio processing

name: Desert
description: An AI decision making system used to optimise detection of acute patients. Within an hour the AI is combining analysing blood and urine test data with the patient history. This should reduce mortality, readmissions and hospitalized bedtime. It is a decision support tool used in combinition with the doctor's expertise.
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: Gladsaxe - AI for predicting child at risk to be abused
description: The municipality of Gladsaxe in Copenhagen is experimenting a system that would use algorithms to identify children at risk of abuse, allowing authorities to target the flagged families for early intervention that could ultimately result in forced removals.  The children would be targeted based on specially designed algorithms tasked with crunching the information already gathered by the Danish government and linked to the personal identification number. This information includes health records, employment information.
type: Expert and rule based systems - algorithmic decision making

name: SUVE Chatbot
description: The websites of several government agencies now have Suve, an automated chatbot which provides answers to frequently asked questions about the emergency situation and the coronavirus. The chatbot provides answers to questions in Estonian and English and uses information from the official sources of government agencies.https://www.valitsus.ee/en/news/chatbot-will-help-you-find-answers-your-questions-about-crisis
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: A model for forecasting the health and treatment needs of the chronically ill
description: The model for forecasting the health and treatment needs of the chronically ill helps the Estonian Health Insurance Fund to detect the health status and treatment needs of patients and better organise the health planning for high risk patient populations such as diabetics or cardiovascular patients.
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: Aurora AI -    Moving to a place of study
description: One of the experimental applications that has been run during the AuroraAI programme focused on the “moving to a place of study” life-event. Two cities involved (Tampere and Turku) carried out well-being surveys among its student populations, and - based on its results - clustered the students into the groups in need of different support. The study has discovered that factors such as reliability of the public transportation, and quality of the natural environment plays an important role in students’ well-being. Data retrieved from the study helped create a new cross-cutting public offering - a bot that would supply information about the topics that students found important. The uptake of the new service has been lackluster, leading the authorities to believe that only proactive marketing could change customers’ behaviour. At the same time, it has been concluded that in order to pursue such projects further, municipalities need to develop user experience awareness and data analytics skills.
type: Chatbots - intelligent digital assistants - virtual agents and recommendation systems

name: Intensive care for premature baby
description: AI system to follow the intensive care of premature baby and equipment. The AI is more accurate to notice some signals better than the doctors, based on IBM Watson. The system works 24/7 without any breaks. This should ensure a better care system for the premature baby, living rate, suport for personal and improved trust in healthcare.
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: Espoo - Identifying individuals in need of social support
description: The experiment aimed at finding out whether customer groups in need of service can be identified earlier than before using artificial intelligence, so that individual information security remains intact – and at the same time, Espoo also wanted to gain an understanding of which factors influence municipality citizens’ wellbeing and service use. Artificial Intelligence identified individuals in need of support.   The experiment combined the social, healthcare and early education client relationship data of the entire population of Espoo for the years 2002–2016. By analysing this data mass, they found new preventive methods for targeting services to municipality citizens, for example to prevent social exclusion. Artificial intelligence helped the City of Espoo to discover customer-centric service paths
type: Predictive analytics - simulation and data visualisation

name: Vee Chatbot
